summary: This is a brief email exchange from July 11, 2019, where a sender forwards a New York Times article about Jeffrey Epstein's net worth to an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York. The subject line references 'Deutsche', likely Deutsche Bank, and the tone is informal and surprised.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The forwarded New York Times article is about his net worth, indicating financial scrutiny.

events.title: NYT publishes article on Epstein's net worth
events.description: The New York Times publishes an article detailing Jeffrey Epstein's net worth, which is then forwarded via email to a federal prosecutor.

keyFacts: An email from July 11, 2019, forwards a New York Times article about Jeffrey Epstein's net worth to an Assistant U.S. Attorney.
The subject line 'Re: Deutsche!' suggests a connection to Deutsche Bank, which was known to have financial ties to Epstein.
The informal tone ('Right?! Wtf?!') and timing (July 2019) indicate active discussion of Epstein's finances around the time of his arrest.
